in a way that is harmless (= not able or not likely to cause harm): It is a species of bacteria that lives harmlessly in every person's gut. The gas will bubble harmlessly to the surface and escape into the atmosphere. See
harmless
More examplesFewer examplesThe shot sailed harmlessly wide of the goal.The low bridge is designed to allow floodwaters to flow harmlessly over.We live in a world where it is possible to harmlessly scan the inside of your brain and watch it working.
